column1: Nonpayment of rent - If a tenant does not pay rent, then after any applicable grace period, the landlord may issue a 7-Day Notice to Pay or Quit. If the tenant does not pay, then the landlord can pursue formal eviction.

Lease violation - If a lease violation occurs then the landlord can issue a 14-Day Notice to Cure or Quit. If the behavior is not remedied in the specified timeframe then they have 30 days to move out before facing eviction.
Illegal acts - If a landlord has documentation of illegal activity occurring on the premises then they may issue a 5-Day Unconditional Notice to Quit.
